subject: Sailboats and Sailing
Suits and Litigation
Boats and Boating
organizations: BMW Oracle Racings Golden Gate Yacht Club
lead_paragraph: The Swiss yacht club that won the last two America’s Cup is asking an American rival to withdraw its lawsuit by Friday to ensure the 2009 competition will be raced on schedule. The Societe Nautique de Geneve, the home of the Cup champion Alinghi, is being sued by the United States syndicate BMW Oracle Racing’s Golden Gate Yacht Club because it says the Spanish boat Desafío Español — which helped establish the 33rd edition’s format — is an “invalid challenger.” If Golden Gate continues with its lawsuit in New York state and wins, it would be able to renegotiate the race format with Alinghi, probably pushing the event into 2010.
